habitat_description:
This distribution of this species extends from Nova Scotia and neighboring areas in southern Canada, south and west to northern New Jersey, Virginia, western Maryland, southern Ohio, west Virginia, northwestern Indiana, Illinois, Missouri, Nebraska, Utah, and into southern Texas. In Mexico, this species is found in the northern region, primarily Chihuahua (Conant and Collins; Grobman 1992; Walley 2003).

This species is found in herbaceous wetland, scrub-shrub wetland, and other riparian habitats. Also, found in grassland, old fields, savanna, shrubland, chaparral, orchards, and various woodland ecosystems. This species is known to burrow in or using soil, leaf litter, and fallen logs, while hibernation occurs sometimes in abandoned ant mounds. It is commonly found in meadows, moist grassy fields, stream borders, bogs, open moist woodland, grassy marshes, and abandoned fields (Natureserve.org).

SW-	Found in grassland, shrubland, and woodland associations.
